subject: Re: [junit] jar file for com.mock.servlet.*
msgSnippet: ... You would do well to separate two ideas: * mocking methods, which is what JMock helps you do * using prebuilt mock objects, like the old mockobjects.com
messageBody:
tksri2000 wrote:

> I have been reading about mock objects and I would like to use them to
> develop junits tests for a servlet that I have recently coded .
> Where would I find the jar files that would have the mock objects
> relating to servlets.

You would do well to separate two ideas:

* mocking methods, which is what JMock helps you do
* using prebuilt mock objects, like the old mockobjects.com project
used to have

The way you write your question makes me think that you're looking for
the second of these, but I recommend instead you look at the first.

My question for you: why do you want to mock a servlet? Which class do
you want to simulate?

Take care.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
